intro: Swainsona decurrens, commonly known as the narrowleaf swainsona, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Swainsona decurrens is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
